page.title: 02The Charitable "Crown".
page.content: The "Crown" is owned by G.Bateman & Son Ltd., of Wainfleet. The Crown sells Bateman's Bitter, Real Ale (also mentioned in CAMRA the good beer guide) Heineken Lager, Whitbreads Trophy and Draught Guinness. It is a village pub with pleasant accommodation catering for fishermen who like to fish on the River Glen close by. Games played in the pub are darts, dominos, crib, table skittles. The Crown customers are very charitable people and have raised over Â£7,000 in eleven years with comic football match, sponsored walk, cricket match, marathon dart match, whist drives, steak nights, dart matches, harvest festival etc. The old folks of Surfleet have benefited from their charity. The Landlady is Mrs. Audrey James.
